page.title: 20Coads Green Methodist Chapel
page.content: Tha chapel is intimately tied in with the life of the community in this grid.The original chapel(now one of school classrooms) was built in 1826. The present chapel sited next to the school was built in 1849. In 1985 the number on the chapel roll is 84 with an average congregation of 55.During this year activities have been organised to raise money for the starving people of Ethiopia and Sudan. The Shell Group(Methodist Jnr.Youth Club) held a sponsored stinging nettle pick for Ethiopia which reached the national radio news. The present minister Rev.Webber is responsible for the services at 11 chapels(this includes Trewint John Wesley's Cornish accomodation). The chapel holds its Sunday School for two age groups in the village school.
